title: What Big Exclusive Does Xbox Need? - Kinda Funny Gamescast Ep. 118 (Pt. 4)

What new exclusive would help Xbox?

A specific game did someone really inspire you to cover video games, and was IGN your dream job? So um, I think my answer to this is very similar to most other people's, and that it was a complete accident. Uh, I was working in this terrible job in a call center which I hated so naturally I was looking for jobs elsewhere, and uh, I'd always loved writing, I'd always love games, and I just saw a listing for a volunteer news writer for a games website, and I was like, "I totally do that on my spare time." So I started doing that, and then it was like this is the best thing, and then just worked my way up to doing it.

"Volunteer news writer for a games website, and I was like, 'I totally do that on my spare time,' so I started doing that, and then was like, 'This is the best thing,' and then just worked my way up to doing it full-time. My first article was published on May 6th, so like kind of soon. Um, what was it? What was the other half of that question? Was it IGN? The dream I wanted to work at a place like IGN or GameSpot, uh, for sure. Um, yeah, it's tough like I work late a lot of the time, and the biggest problem I have is that I live with a bunch of uh housemates who when I get home at like 10:00 p.m. at night off to work and going to the gym, and then I I can't make a video because it would be super rude because I would keep all my housemates up, so that is like the biggest problem is finding the time. It's also like it's very hard for me to respond to things, like I make videos about lifestyle stuff or current news, like I did a Pepsi ad reaction video which was like okay I know I have to do this right now but how the heck do I find the time to do that? It's really hard to respond to things immediately.
